data.title: Top Songs of 1964
data.meta_description: All US top 40 singles for 1964 including drops, power hits and debuts. Notable artists include The Beatles, Marvin Gaye, The Rolling Stones, The Dixie Cups
data.text:
Did you enjoy this 1964 Music Through the Years Video above? Then be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to see all of our Top40Weekly videos!

These are all the Top Songs of 1964.

*Note: Based on the Nolan Method, these are the year-end songs that represented the best songs of 1964. The Nolan Method ranking system was formulated by lead Top40Weekly contributor Jarrett Nolan and is based on a point system for an artist’s chart performance on Billboard charts. Be sure to check out our Year in Music snapshot of what was happening in the world of Top 40 music in this decade. Written by radio and music industry veteran Ed Osborne, each overview highlights the important trends and some of the representative songs and artists that shaped the music landscape and occupied the Top 40 charts during this decade of music.

US Top 40 Singles for the Week Ending 1st February, 1964

And for my final Beatles note, this week was the official start of Beatlemania as “I Want To Hold Your Hand” hits #1, becoming the first of many #1’s from this point forward – until 1970. And “Please Please Me” enters the charts this week at #68 and “She Loves you” jumps 48 spots to land at #21
